SENT.plain: The acrocephalosyndactylies (ACS) are a group of inherited disorders characterized by premature fusion of cranial sutures in association with abnormalities of the hands and feet
Based on their clinical features, different types of ACS have been described
We here report on a family with 9 individuals affected with ACS III (Saethre-Chotzen syndrome), 5 of them severely
Clinical features of the patients are presented with regard to differential diagnostic delineations
